audience.name: Audience
audience.definition: Knowing your intended audience will help you customize your message. Your audiences existing beliefs, habits, and experiences can all impact the story you tell.
audience.tooltip: Who is the intended target of your story?
audience.example: Our audience is adults over the age of 18 who can vote and support legislation to combat gender pay gap. Our audience may think that the gender pay gap has already been resolved and is no longer a major issue. Similatly, some of our audience may subscribe to cultural gender role of the past. Many of our audience believe in equality and fairness and can relate to being lied to, uncompensated, or unappreciated.
description: Consider the following:
Who might listen and also be able to create change?
What are some alternative stances your audience might hold?
What experiences or beliefs might your audience relate to?

fields.title: Audience
fields.placeholder: Write who your intended audience is here
fields.info: Whose is the specific target of your message. What are there characteristics?

fields.name: user_change
fields.title: Change
fields.placeholder: Write why this audience can create change

fields.name: user_beliefs
fields.title: Beliefs
fields.info: What existing beliefs might your audience hold that relate to your story and issue?

background.name: Background
background.example: Women have long suffered pay discrimation due to gender discrimination, societal norms, and maternity leave (otherwise known as the motherhood penalty). Anti-discrimination legislation is only effective if it can be enforce. Despite prior efforts, women still are experiencing unequal wages in the workforce.
background.definition: Researching the details of your issue is essential for conveying credibiltiy to the audience. Likewise people may not know the details or background of the issue.
description: Consider the following goals:
Demonstrate you know your issue
Catch audiences up with important facts
Add important context of what causes  the issue
background.tooltip: Details for your audience who might not know much about your isssue.

fields.name: user_importance
fields.title: Importance
fields.placeholder: Write why this issue deserves attention
fields.info: Why this issue deserves the audience's attention

fields.name: user_rightness
fields.title: Rightness
fields.placeholder: Write why your stance is just or fair
fields.info: Why this a just cause or explain why your stance is fair

fields.name: user_history
fields.title: History
fields.info: What has happened over time with this issue that an audience should know?

personal_story.name: Personal Story
personal_story.definition: Personal stories about individuals affected by your issue can help audiences visualize the problem. Stories help elicit powerful emotions that resonate with audiences and motivate them to pay attention and act.
description: Consider the following for a personal story:
Humanizes the issue and adds additional details
Elicits emotional reactions such as sympathy or outrage
Brief but with a powerful message
Story or quotes of real people
personal_story.example: Vivianne Castillo described how many women don’t know they are being discriminated against. A manager said her position in the company couldn’t receive a type of pay. She later found her white colleages in the same position were receiving the payment.
personal_story.tooltip: A compelling story about specific individuals affected by this issue to motivate audiences

fields.name: user_individual
fields.title: Individual
fields.info: Write about the individual whose story you want to tell

fields.name: user_story
fields.title: Story
fields.info: Write about the event related to your issue and how it impacted the individual

supporting_insights.name: Supporting Insights
supporting_insights.definition: Having other facts shows that you've done your research and also may help audiences who are still undecided on the issue. Other facts and findings from your data can support the main insight and bolster confidence that they are accurate.
supporting_insights.tooltip: Other findings that support your stance on the issue
supporting_insights.example: The gender pay gap hardly improved in 20 years. In 2022 women earned an average of 82% of what men earned, which is more or less the same as 2002 where they earned 80% as much as men.
description: Consider the following for your supporting insights:
Alternative evidence that help confirm your main insight
Data findings that describe more specific scenarios or cases
Other facts that are related to your main insight or issue

fields.name: user_support
fields.title: Supporting Insight
fields.info: What finding from the data or relevant fact do you want to include?

fields.name: user_connection
fields.title: Connection
fields.placeholder: Write how this supports your main insight and campaign
fields.info: How will this particular finding or fact help support your campaign story or main insight?

main_insights.name: Main Insights
main_insights.tooltip: Your main insight is the top finding from the data to highlight.
main_insights.definition: The top finding in the data from your team that you wish to highlight. Similar to the climax, it is the height of your story.
description: Main insights often have the following characteristics:
Shocking or Interesting
Clear and Direct
Inspires Action
main_insights.example: 36% of students in the county are ethnic minorities but only 5% of teachers in the county are ethnic minorities.

fields.name: user_insight
fields.title: Insight
fields.info: The top finding in the data you want to highlight

fields.name: user_explanation
fields.title: Explanation
fields.placeholder: Write why you chose this to highlight
fields.info: Why you are highlighting this finding

call_to_action.name: Call to Action
call_to_action.definition: The goal of an advocacy campaign is to enact real change! To do that, you want to motivate your audience to act. This is your chance to call upon those listening to create change.
description: Consider the following suggestions:
Be specific, make it clear how to help
Explain how this helps your cause
Be persuasive, motivate the audience
call_to_action.tooltip: A response you hope your audience might take towards the cause
call_to_action.example: We can't fix the gap we don't know about! Support legislation to force companies to disclose their gender pay gap!

fields.name: user_action
fields.title: Action
fields.info: What action do you want your audience to take? Be specific!

fields.name: user_explanation
fields.title: Explanation
fields.placeholder: Write how this action will help
fields.info: How will this particular action help improve/solve your issue?
